title: refactor(simple-tcp): Extract timeout error checking into helper function
body:
## Summary

The timeout error checking pattern is duplicated in 3 functions in `SocketSimple-tcp.c`:
- Line 54 (Socket_simple_connect_timeout)
- Line 175 (Socket_simple_accept_timeout)
- Line 292 (Socket_simple_recv_timeout)

## Current Pattern

```c
if (Socket_error_is_retryable (err) && (err == ETIMEDOUT || err == EAGAIN))
{
    simple_set_error (SOCKET_SIMPLE_ERR_TIMEOUT, "...");
}
```

Note: Line 54 checks for `EINPROGRESS` instead of `EAGAIN`.

## Recommendation

Extract into a static helper function to reduce redundancy:

```c
static inline int
is_timeout_error(int err)
{
    return Socket_error_is_retryable(err) && 
           (err == ETIMEDOUT || err == EAGAIN || err == EINPROGRESS);
}
```

Then replace all instances with:

```c
if (is_timeout_error(err))
{
    simple_set_error (SOCKET_SIMPLE_ERR_TIMEOUT, "...");
}
```

## Benefits

- Reduces code duplication
- Centralizes timeout detection logic
- Easier to maintain and test
- Ensures consistent timeout handling across all functions

## File

- `src/simple/SocketSimple-tcp.c`

## Category

Redundancy / Refactoring

## Severity

MEDIUM

## Pattern ID

REDUNDANT_TIMEOUT_CHECK
